node.display_long_description:
Ride to every corner of the world while getting a full-body cardio workout!

EXPLORE
From the snow capped Italian Alps to the sun kissed coast of Oahu, experience our planet’s beauty over 10 million miles of roads through Google Street View**.

MAKE IT YOURS
Create your own rides and share them with the community! Earn coins while riding to customize your rider.

KEEP CONNECTED
Ride with a friend or training partner wherever they are in the world. 

FAMILY FRIENDLY
Free profiles allow everyone using your Quest to track their own stats and progress. One subscription covers the entire family.

Optionally use your bike or elliptical with the addition of a cadence sensor.

Start your journey today with a 7-day free premium trial* to begin your ride around the world.

Where will you ride first?

*$0 for duration of free trial, $9.99/month thereafter. Cancel at any time. Terms apply. Go to vzfit.com for more detail.
**Uses Google Street View data but is not an official Google product.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
New Achievement System! In game, on web, and in Oculus dashboard
"Read_external_files" permission no longer asked or required (this is the request for Storage permissions when launching)
72 frame per second City Mode on Quest 2
Slightly longer peaks for HIIT workouts
Fixed stuck ride case
Fixed mute voice after leaving/rejoining same leader
Possible fix to missing coins after long jumps forward in rides
Option for No Socks and No Gloves in avatar customization
Character model improvements
Tutorial tracking
Comfort mode improvements

nodes.title: Launch Update
nodes.body_text:
Wow!  What a week!?

We have been working on this release of VZfit for many months and it’s so exciting to have it out in the world and available for everyone to easily try. With the new standing mode feature and the ability to play the tutorial without an account we have had more people try VZfit in one week than we have had in the last 2 years!

From new users to our long time veterans the response to the experience has been amazing. It’s truly inspiring to the team to know that we have helped you achieve your goals or provided a fun way to get more fit.

For us, it’s back to work though!  VZfit is a living, breathing product and we know that there is so much more that we can do to make it a better experience.

First Update
While overall the launch went smoothly we did find a couple of bugs that will be fixed in our first update. The most major of which is new users are currently not defaulting to auto-steering. This should be the default for standing mode and we want to make sure we get it fixed as soon as possible. In addition to that we do have one major feature that didn’t make launch and that is our achievement system.

We will be adding achievements to both VZfit.com and the Oculus system that will have some great long term and short term goals for you to shoot for.

Our plan is to get this update released at the start of May and it should be going into testing next week!



Beyond
As far as what comes after that?  We have some customization updates and avatar updates in the works and we should have more information on that once this first update goes out.  We will keep an eye on the feedback from new users and hope to hear from you all on what you love as well as what you think needs a little polish!

Our team also wants to specifically thank our Facebook community for helping out with questions and support this week. The help has been invaluable for new users. If you are not a member of the VZfit community on Facebook we highly encourage it. They are a great group for inspiration, encouragement, and ideas. https://www.facebook.com/groups/vzfit

Thanks again to everyone who tried VZfit and be sure to keep checking in for regular updates.

Cheers and Happy Exploring!

nodes.title: January Update is Live!
nodes.body_text:
January has been a great month for all of us with our VZfit users burning almost 3 Million VZcals!  How's that for nailing your resolutions!  With so many new users and coming on we put our focus on the new user experience for this update.

New Tutorials
New users will now begin their journey with a tutorial on the exerboard. From rendering modes to steering, this tutorial features everything you need to learn to get started in VZfit.  Additionally, we added video tutorials for some of the more advanced options in the game.


New Voice Over
Both the male and female coaches have had a voiceover update. We have also added multiple levels of voice over to suit your needs. Coaching mode is on by default and will offer you the most feedback on your ride.

New Continents Filter
In addition to the filters in last update we have now added a quick filter for toggling on and off specific continents. This can help you find a ride in a specific region and get you exploring faster!


New Store Items
We have added some more items to the store with a pretty great road warrior style jersey!


If you want to check out all the details be sure to visit our Updates page https://www.virzoom.com/2021/01/03/vzfit-update-january-2021/. We are off to a great start of the year and hope you are to!

Cheers and Happy Exploring!

node.reviewDescription: I understand this is a small team of developers. It’s a good idea, but using google maps as a foundation doesn’t work well. Everything is blocky and movement is clunky, even when it’s working at its best. Perhaps the team should focus on creating 5 to 10 of their own journeys that render properly. Maybe if this was a one time purchase, it would make sense. I’m not against subscriptions if there is enough value (I’m an active subscriber to Supernatural), but there is not enough value here for it to use a subscription model. I’ll commend the team for offering a 7 day free trial (and recommend they make it 30 days). I will also say I enjoy how movement works in the game, but without immersive environments it gets boring quickly. Also the ‘comfort mode’ is deeply strange, not immersive and unusable. Until they are able to build their own journeys or are able to render google street view images in a way that look like you are in that environment without the blocky weirdness I won’t be subscribing for $10 a month.

developerResponse.body:
Thanks for the feedback! To clarify on the other reviews; we have had thousands of users playing VZfit for the past year and a half. So there are are a ton of people with lots of experience in the app posting their experience from pre-release.
After the free trial you will still have access to the App and we rotate a free ride location every month so you can continue to check in as we make updates.
If you have a bike and sensor we do have fully immersive environments in VZPlay, which is included in the subscription, with games that do not utilize Google Street View. Also, you may enjoy comfort mode if the distortion bothers you. In this mode we do not 'move' you through the world but instead present you with clear undistorted images as you move. Thanks for giving it a try we really do appreciate it! If you have any more questions feel free to reach out to support!

website_page_meta.description:
Have Fun. Explore the World. Get Fit.

Full-body cardio workouts you will actually enjoy!

From the snow capped Italian Alps to the coast of Oahu, workout virtually anywhere.

Optionally use a bike or an elliptical with the addition of a cadence sensor.

Start your journey today with a 7 day free trial!*

*$0 for duration of free trial, $9.99/month thereafter. Cancel any time. Terms apply. Go to vzfit.com for more detail.
VZfit uses Google Street View data but is not an official Google product.
